miic.core.plot_fun.plot_single_corr_matrix¶

plot_single_corr_matrix(corr_mat, seconds=0, filename=None, normalize=True, normtype='absmax', norm_time_win=[None, None], clim=[], figsize=(8, 6), dpi=72)[source]¶

Plot a single correlation matrix.

A simple plot of the correlation matrix corr_mat is generated and saved under filename + ‘_corrMatrix.png’. If filename is an empty string (default) the figure is saved under ‘./plot_default_corrMatrix.png’. An optional parameter center_win_len can be passed that restricts the length of the plotted traces to the respective number of samples in the center.

Parameters:
  • corr_mat (dictionary of the type correlation matrix) – correlation matrix to be plotted
  • seconds (int) – How many seconds will be taken from the central part of the correlation function (in a symmetric way respect to zero time lag)
  • filename (string) – complete path the file under which the figure is to be saved
  • normalize (bool) – If True the matix will be normalized before plotting
  • normtype (string) – one of the following ‘energy’, ‘max’, ‘absmax’, ‘abssum’ to decide about the way to calculate the normalization.
  • norm_time_win (list) – list contaning start- and endtime in seconds of time window used for normalization
  • clim (list) – lower and upper limit of the colorscale for plotting. Empty list uses default color range
